org.parboiled
Class BaseActions<V>

java.lang.Object
  org.parboiled.BaseActions<V>
Type Parameters:
V - the type of the value field of a parse tree node
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContextAware<V>
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseParser
public abstract class BaseActions<V>
extends Object
implements ContextAware<V>

Convenience context aware base class defining a number of useful helper methods.

getContext

public Context<V> getContext()
The current context for use with action methods. Updated immediately before action calls.

Returns:
the current context

setContext

                       Context<V> context)
ContextAware interface implementation.

Specified by:
setContext in interface ContextAware<V>
Parameters:
context - the context

node

public Node<V> node(String path)
Returns the first parse tree node found under the given prefix path. See ParseTreeUtils.findNodeByPath(org.parboiled.Node, String) for a description of the path argument. The path is relative to the current context scope, which can be changed with BaseParser.UP(Object) or BaseParser.DOWN(Object).

Parameters:
path - the path to search for
Returns:
the parse tree node if found or null if not found

nodes

@NotNull
public List<Node<V>> nodes(String path)
Returns a list of all parse tree nodes found under the given prefix path. See ParseTreeUtils.findNodeByPath(org.parboiled.Node, String) )} for a description of the path argument. The path is relative to the current context scope, which can be changed with BaseParser.UP(Object) or BaseParser.DOWN(Object).

Parameters:
path - the path to search for
Returns:
the list of parse tree nodes

nodeByLabel

public Node<V> nodeByLabel(String labelPrefix)
Returns the first parse tree node found with the given label prefix. See ParseTreeUtils.findNodeByPath(org.parboiled.Node, String) for a description of the path argument. The search is performed in the current context scope, which can be changed with BaseParser.UP(Object) or BaseParser.DOWN(Object).

Parameters:
labelPrefix - the label prefix
Returns:
the parse tree node if found or null if not found

nodesByLabel

@NotNull
public List<Node<V>> nodesByLabel(String labelPrefix)
Returns a list of all parse tree nodes found under the given prefix path. See ParseTreeUtils.findNodeByPath(org.parboiled.Node, String) )} for a description of the path argument. The search is performed in the current context scope, which can be changed with BaseParser.UP(Object) or BaseParser.DOWN(Object).

Parameters:
labelPrefix - the label prefix
Returns:
the list of parse tree nodes

lastNode

public Node<V> lastNode()
Returns the last node created during this parsing run. This last node is independent of the current context scope, i.e. BaseParser.UP(Object) or BaseParser.DOWN(Object) have no influence on it.

Returns:
the last node created during this parsing run

value

public V value()
Returns the tree value of the current context scope, i.e., if there is an explicitly set value it is returned. Otherwise the last non-null child value, or, if there is no such value, null.

Returns:
the tree value of the current context scope

Returns the value of the given node.

Parameters:

Returns:
the value of the node, or null if the node is null

Returns the value of the node found under the given prefix path. Equivalent to value(node(path)).

path - the path to search for
Returns:
the value of the node, or null if the node is not found

lastChar

public Character lastChar()
Returns the first character of the input text matched by the last node created during this parsing run. Equivalent to character(lastNode()).

Returns:
the first character of the input text matched by the last node created

prevValue

public V prevValue()

Returns the value object of the rule immediately preceeding the action expression that is currently being evaluated. This call can only be used in actions that are part of a Sequence rule and are not at first position in this Sequence.

This call is Context agnostic, i.e. it can be wrapped by an arbitrary number of UP() / DOWN() wrappers and will always return the same result.

This method does not rely on the generated parse tree nodes and can therefore also be used in parts of the grammar where parse tree node creation is suppressed.

Returns:
the value object of the immediately preceeding subrule

prevText

public String prevText()

Returns the input text matched by the context immediately preceeding the action expression that is currently being evaluated. This call can only be used in actions that are part of a Sequence rule and are not at first position in this Sequence.

This call is internally delegated to the deepest active Context in the current Context stack, i.e. it can be wrapped by an arbitrary number of UP() / DOWN() wrappers and will always return the same result.

This method does not rely on the generated parse tree nodes and can therefore also be used in parts of the grammar where parse tree node creation is suppressed.

Returns:
the input text matched by the immediately preceeding subrule

prevChar

public Character prevChar()
Returns the first character of the input text matched by the rule immediately preceeding the action expression that is currently being evaluated. Only valid on the deepest currently active context in the context stack, which must be for a SequenceMatcher and the action currently being run must not be the first rule of this Sequence. This method does not rely on the generated parse tree nodes and can therefore also be used in parts of the grammar where parse tree node creation is suppressed.

Returns:
the first character of the input text matched by the immediately preceeding subrule

prevStart

public int prevStart()

Returns the start index of the matched rule immediately preceeding the action expression that is currently being evaluated. This call can only be used in actions that are part of a Sequence rule and are not at first position in this Sequence.

This call is Context agnostic, i.e. it can be wrapped by an arbitrary number of UP() / DOWN() wrappers and will always return the same result.

This method does not rely on the generated parse tree nodes and can therefore also be used in parts of the grammar where parse tree node creation is suppressed.

Returns:
the start index of the context immediately preceeding current action

prevEnd

public int prevEnd()

Returns the end location of the matched rule immediately preceeding the action expression that is currently being evaluated. This call can only be used in actions that are part of a Sequence rule and are not at first position in this Sequence.

This call is Context agnostic, i.e. it can be wrapped by an arbitrary number of UP() / DOWN() wrappers and will always return the same result.

This method does not rely on the generated parse tree nodes and can therefore also be used in parts of the grammar where parse tree node creation is suppressed.

Returns:
the end index of the context immediately preceeding current action, i.e. the index of the character immediately following the last matched character

set

public boolean set()
Sets the value of the parse tree node to be created for the current context scope to the value of the immediately preceeding rule that just matched. Equivalent to set(prevValue()). Check prevValue() for constraints and further information.

Returns:
true

set

public boolean set(V value)
Sets the value of the parse tree node to be created for the current context scope to the given value.

Parameters:
value - the value to set
Returns:
true

currentChar

public Character currentChar()
Returns the next input character about to be matched.

Returns:
the next input character about to be matched

inPredicate

public boolean inPredicate()
Returns true if the current rule is running somewhere underneath a Test/TestNot rule. Useful for example for making sure actions are not run inside of a predicate evaluation: return Sequence( ..., inPredicate() || actions.doSomething() );

Returns:
true if in a predicate

nodeSuppressed

public boolean nodeSuppressed()
Returns true if the current context is for or below a rule marked @SuppressNode or below one marked @SuppressSubnodes.

Returns:
true or false

hasError

public boolean hasError()
Determines whether the current rule or a sub rule has recorded a parse error. Useful for example for making sure actions are not run on erroneous input: return Sequence( ..., !hasError() && actions.doSomething() );

Returns:
true if either the current rule or a sub rule has recorded a parse error
